definition: to dip a finger (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action/abbr. for 染指於鼎|染指于鼎
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
lit. dirty finger, mouth watering (idiom); fig. greedy to seize sth
lit. dip one's finger in the tripod (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action

sentences.english: To hand, some of it inevitably sticks to the fingers that it touches.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款几经转手，必然有一部分被经手人染指。

sentences.english: Now, every school is being touched.
sentences.chinese: 现在，每一所学校都被染指。

sentences.english: He won't allow anyone to chisel in on his profits.
sentences.chinese: 他不允许任何人染指他的利润。

sentences.english: Lando's new world came crashing down around him when the Empire arrived at Cloud City.
sentences.chinese: 帝国染指云城后，兰多的新世界在他身边轰然倒塌。

sentences.english: Thy body is white like the lilies of a field that the mower hath never mowed.
sentences.chinese: 您的身体就像旷野里从未被割草人染指的百合。

sentences.english: Can he win a title without Shaquille O'Neal?
sentences.chinese: 他能够在没有鲨鱼奥尼尔的情况下染指冠军？

sentences.english: These English beauties are available to everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这些英国佳丽谁都可以染指。

sentences.english: As a master of Kunqu opera, Shen Jing was also involved in the creation of Zaju.
sentences.chinese: 作为一代昆曲大师，沈在杂剧创作方面也有所染指。

definition: to covet/to long for/to lust after
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to dominate (a market etc)/to monopolize
to monopolize/to control/to dominate
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to be carried away by one's wishful thinking (idiom)/to labor under a delusion/wishful thinking
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
exclusive property/forbidden domain
to water at the mouth/to drool
to control/to dominate/to monopolize
to annex
to conspire
to snatch away
to spy upon/to lie in wait for (an opportunity)
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
